content.question: Which of the following best explains why transoceanic migration increased significantly in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries?

choices.label: The development of bourgeois society in Europe led to the adoption of a tiered system of classes of travel on oceangoing ships.
The increased demand for plantation labor in the Americas resulted in larger numbers of African enslaved people being transported across the Atlantic.
New navigational techniques allowed ships to traverse the open ocean instead of needing to sail along the coasts.
The development of steam-powered ships made it easier and safer for people to cross the oceans.

content.answer: The development of steam-powered ships made it easier and safer for people to cross the oceans.

topic.text: 6.6: Causes of Migration in an Interconnected World
